Description: Foot of East Greek pottery stemmed cup; brown fired glaze on exterior and underside; resting surface and outer face of foot reserved; inscription cut twice on underside (once on resting surface and once on inner face of foot).
Curator's comments: Debatable whether this piece is East Greek or Attic; the quality of the glaze and slight amount of mica point more to the former.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 464)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (East Greek 206)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.236)
